website_summaries.verdict: Owners are split on the heavily scented pad, which masks odors from multiple uses.
pros: Absorbs a lot of liquid, owners find, with little to no leakage
Good for multiple uses, in some cases
Most owners like the scented pad, which masks odors after use
cons: Some owners feel the lavender scent is too strong

website_summaries.verdict: If you are sensitive to urine odors, these lavender-scented pads are the choice for you.
pros: Liquid instantly turns to gel to prevent leaks and odors
Plastic backing and border helps protect against leaks
Neutralizes odors instead of masking them
Six-layer construction creates a small urine spot, allowing dog to use it multiple times
Good for puppy training, elderly or sick dogs, indoor stays, and travel
cons: Some dogs dislike the lavender scent and avoid the pads

customer_reviews.title: Not what expected lies..........
customer_reviews.text: I bought these exact pee pads at my local Walmart and they smell like lavender when you open the box. these are odorless although the package says lavender sent. It’s nice to be lied too. Too much trouble to send back but never ordering from this doop again. Wish I could give it a 0000000
customer_reviews.author: Tammie Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Train you puppy from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: We trained our Yorkies 2 with Hartz XXL training pads from puppies. These dogs are10 years and have used Hartz pads, in the crate open at all times to use if needed especially at night as one dog is diabetic and the other one just likes get up at night. Hartz has been the go to potty pad no smell and absorbs a larger urine spot well. CarolinAZ
customer_reviews.author: Carol R in AZ

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: WORSE HAVE EVER PURCHASED and I buy pee pads all the time for my two yorkies. They do EXACTLY what they say they DO NOT DO...THEY LEAK TERRIBLY...Takes two and three stacked on top of one another AND/or a towel underneath for me to place on my hardwood floors, carpet, tile or any type flooring. These pads not only leak off to the sides but the pee leaks through the pad and gets soaked on other side. WORSE EVER PURCHASED. Cannot imagine having large dog pee. I bought into the advertising. Do these people actually try out their products. Try having a yorkie pee on them near the sides...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick drying because it's quick leaking.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 lb Chihuahua puppy and a clean brand new pad will leak completely through after just one potty. The top dries quickly because it leaks straight through to the bottom, soaks the plastic layer underneath which then soaks any surface that the pad is on. Stack 3-4 of these on top of one another if you're going to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Munro

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE SEE *UPDATE BELOW!
customer_reviews.text: I’m SO glad I found these! The last pads didn’t work well, left urine on my floor. With these, my floors remain dry and I love the lavender scent as well. Now I don’t dread cleaning up after my “old man” every morning! Will definitely purchase again! *UPDATE: I reported that there is no leakage underneath these pads as with others I’ve used. I hate to say, but when my little guy urinates after hours of my being gone, the urine is also underneath these pads and I’m just sick about it! They’re still better than others and I still like the scent, but just not quite as much as I was...
customer_reviews.author: 1mjslove

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my new puppy for potty training and they are not the best quality. They are super slippery when my dog goes over to pee on the they slide and he ends up missing every-time. Also, they are not the most absorbent pee from a 8 lb dog seeps through the bottom. Lastly, this does not turn into a "gel" by any means. It a cheap basic pee pad. I bought AKC training pads 100 for $14 and amazing I don't plan on switching.
customer_reviews.author: Andraea Theoharis

customer_reviews.title: Senior dogs need special attention
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to use this product to prevent accidents with a senior dog, be prepared to wet an area with a small amount of the dog's urine so s/he recognizes the spot as ok for peeing. My dog thought it was a new rug, at first, and continued to pee on the kitchen tile. You also have to become more diligent about watching them after they eat or drink as their hearing may not be as keen and their muscles are not as strong. They want to do the right thing, but they are (after all) old. We owe them our greater attention for the years of service they have given, don't we?
customer_reviews.author: paulinedove

customer_reviews.title: Great safety for those "oops"moments
customer_reviews.text: I have a "hidden" cat litter box table. It's made of wood. I have 3 cats. See the risk? Lol I place 1 of these under the box to line the wood for protection from those times a darling kitty decides to not fully enter the box. I don't notice the scent but then again I'm not putting my face right up on it. It does exactly what I need it to do. They're also great to have on hand for other scenarios. A sick child, on the seat/ couch of a potty training child, on the bed to use as a safety pad while changing a baby. The uses are endless!
customer_reviews.author: Irene Kel

customer_reviews.title: There has been a change in mfg. process. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: There has been a change in these pads. They are thinner which makes it easy for a dog to pee on them and it runs over the side so leak proof is out. Training a dog to pee right in the middle of the pad is quite difficult. When are these manufacturers going to make the outer rim of pad thicker to help stop leaks? I now buy huge pads for small dog avoiding the issue. Very disappointed in change in these pads. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly dog whose hind end is paralyzed. Most of the time she makes it outside to go to the bathroom, but there are times when she doesn't sense that she has to go. I just bought a new house and was concerned about the hardwood floors, so I started putting these pads underneath her. They are wonderfully absorbent. The only downside is that after using them for several weeks, the lavender scent has started to get to me. As a result, I have started ordering the unscented.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Andros

customer_reviews.title: Deserves 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why anyone would give these less than 4 stars. They work as intended. My 7 week old puppy learned to use her puppy pads fast. She picked up the lavender scent quickly. I place two in different spots of a room because I know how dogs like to travel and sniff around. Overall, I am very satisfied and purchase the $5 ones frequently. I will soon start to let her transition to going potty outside. My vet recommended taking a puppy pad out into the yard to let her smell it. We'll see if it works!
customer_reviews.author: 𝒦𝒶𝓈𝑒𝓎

customer_reviews.title: Not good At all
customer_reviews.text: These pads are awful. I take part responsibility because I failed to check whether these pads were quilted (they are not) so if you step on it by accident when wet, you may well slip. Also these pads are folded so small that they don’t lay flat when unfolded, and whatever sticky stuff they use to fold them remains sticky. As in, they stick to you foot when you step on them, and you trail the pad along behind you. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: Really don't find these to be any different that a normal pee pad. If you dog steps on the pee spot it IS wet and will track. They have a VERY strong fragrance. I can't imagine that they don't bother a dogs nose because they are too strong smelling for me. I put them in the closet and the scent is overwhelming. Not worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Hipkat

customer_reviews.title: No leakage!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I placed me second order for 70 pads yesterday. I was a little skeptical on buying this product. Because obviously, like everyone else, I want the best of the best! I read the reviews before buying this product and decided for the price I could try it out. No leakage, perfect size in my opinion. I have a 2 month old puppy we're trying to paddy train, still a work in progress. I go the extra mile of wiping off the floor with a disinfectant spray when throwing away the pad but it's not needed. I would recommend this product t if your not trying to spend so much money. Satisfied customer (:
customer_reviews.author: janet ruiz

customer_reviews.title: So bad, it's shocking
customer_reviews.text: Got these to potty train our 2 month old puppy. If the pee is even slightly off center and closer toward the edge, the mat leaks. Even with perfect centering, the pee somehow seeps through the plastic onto the floor. And the weird greenish dye they add to the mat turns my dogs paws and legs greenish yellow. The one positive thing might be that the aroma of these is not off-putting, but dogs definitely don't need to have something so fragrant punching them in their heightened sense of smell. Anyway, I would have been better off just training our puppy to pee on the microfiber towels I inevitably clean the messes up with.
customer_reviews.author: xayc

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressed with these, zero accidents since ordering them.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews on anything, but am very impressed with these pee pads. My dog is a chiweenie, about 6lbs and I used to have all sorts of issues with it missing the pad, pee running off, etc. Something about these makes the dog pee right in the middle of them and they haven't leaked yet. Really happy with the pads and the fact that they don't stink like pee. Will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: martytheman

customer_reviews.title: keeps my home odor free
customer_reviews.text: I am not potty training a pet but do find these pads great lining the tray that the cat litter box is on. I have one cat that insists on "thinking outside the box"... if you know what I mean. The pads trap the urine and there is no urine odor whatsoever. I also have two large breed dogs that no matter what I do, slop water all around their water bowl when they drink. I now keep the bowl on one of those boot trays and put one of these Hartz pads under it. ... no more mess around the water bowl. I have been using these Hartz pads for several years and will continue to do so!
customer_reviews.author: Vikki M.

customer_reviews.title: Why so sticky?!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these for the lavender scent. They are not great at absorbing large amounts of urine. These pads are definitely for puppies. I have small chihuahuas and more than 2 piddles and it Soaks through. The scent is very pleasant and my dogs have not minded. They use the pads no issues. The one thing that will make me NEVER order these again is that they’re sticky. If you so much touch them they cling to you. I sometimes have to step over them (clean of course) to get to the laundry room and these stupid pads always stick to my foot. Makes me so mad! 😡 Giving 3 stars for the scent and size.
customer_reviews.author: Alkalina

customer_reviews.title: Diabetic elderly dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog was recently diagnosed with diabetes and he can’t hold his bladder all night. He drinks a ton of water and so he goes potty A LOT. It’s almost like spilling his water bowl all over the floor. I was using the blue and white pads and they wouldn’t hold anything. I tried these and they are perfect! I layer them because he urinates so much it would be impossible for him to only use one. He pees they about two a night but I’ll take that over cleaning and mopping a floor every morning. These things are a life saver for me. My dog is also not little. He’s about 50 lbs
customer_reviews.author: CASSANDRA O.

customer_reviews.title: Work as described but one drawback
customer_reviews.text: These pads work as advertised but there is a problem. They stick to anything that steps on them. So, when my puppy goes, the pad sometimes sticks to the hair on her feet and the pad is dragged along. If my shoes are not slick on the bottom, they will stick to the pad like velcro. That is fine for sticking one pad on another but this can be a problem if you have socks or slipper or whatever on. You will have to pull the pad off. Overall, I probably will pay more for the Amazon brand as it is slightly larger and does not have the problem of sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: I got these pads for my 25 pound cocker spaniel, as her mate recently died, and thus she has resorted to wetting everywhere...even in the car when taking her for rides! We are soon traveling across state by car, and need something very absorbent for both in the car, the hotels, and my father-in-laws. These pads have almost NO absorbency...after just one use!! The only thing I liked about them is the nice lavender scent.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Mays

customer_reviews.title: The best pad I have ever used and never smells bad..
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pad because I adopted a Siberian Husky that she needs a quality pad to urinate on. This pad absorbs great and never smells like urine. I only wish it came in a little bigger size like a 26' x 30' instead of only 21' x 30'. Just a few more inches would make a world of difference. Never the less, I still love these pads. I have tried other brands but I could never get passed the awful smell the others omitted. Lavender is the way to go. I haven't experienced any leakage through the plastic underneath so I will give these pads 5 stars and recommend them to everyone. I love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nichelle

customer_reviews.title: Good cost but below average product
customer_reviews.text: I have a small puppy and tile, and after a few orders of these I'm going to stop purchasing them. The quilted top does nothing to lock in the urine and it leaks through the thin plastic underneath. The border does not keep the urine from spreading off the edge either. The smell is okay, but it doesn't absorb odors or anything. The "gel" is some fluffy fiber that will move and gather in part of the pad if you handle it too much or shake it out. Going to buy a different brand to see if there's something better quality to use instead.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Puffy Doggy Pads!  Absorbs the best!
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy my doggy pads from Ross or Burlington but due to covid I wasn’t able to get the brand that I normally get. These one are not like the normal super flat sheet The pad is puffier than what I’m used to. And fatter. Compared to the other dogs pads I’ve had. They do absorb a lot better than the ones I am used I will say that. These are not the ones I would rebuy, only because of the puffy gel factor. But if you want something to hold a heavier load, this may be the best one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Kaydollabill

customer_reviews.title: Very thin
customer_reviews.text: Scent was nice but the size of these pads were small. My Mia wasn’t a big dog. Sadly she is no longer with us. When she walked on the pads her pads would stick to the pad and the pad would move because of this. I had bought 2 packages because the price was right. Now I have a whole package in a half left. I will be donating them either to an animal shelter or if I can find someone who can use them.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa R

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Was not happy with this at all. Has a faint scent but it's so thin it won't stay in place at all. Slides all over, really worthless. I ended up going to Walmart, it's the Great Value name, got 150 of them for $30 something. it has double sided tape on all corners to keep it in place. Believe me, that's what makes the pad work. If the animal pee's on the edge it will spill over but if it pee's in middle it's ok. You don't need something scented if they go that's not going to help with the smell... just replace the pad!
customer_reviews.author: Bheart77

customer_reviews.title: tread lightly
customer_reviews.text: I received the dog pads on time. I noticed a lack of density and texture. With our back door opened a few times a day, the pads easily get easily displaced. Even the air from the air register may shift it. This pad holds a fair amount of dog urine but questionable when the pad is soaked completely. I have a med size dog. He steps on the pad and when he alights from the pad it moves and shifts.
customer_reviews.author: mijaq

customer_reviews.title: Five stars-Great dog pads
customer_reviews.text: Have 3 dogs trained to use indoor pads. Tried Costco brand for 3 years- terrible - they leak and run off. Even if dog pees in center. I switched to Hartz and love them. They have a pleasant scent, 100% absorbent, and urine run off free if dog pees towards the center of the pad. If dog pees very close to the edge the pad will not have capacity to absorb all liquid. However, Hartz are the best pads in the market.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Poor product advertising and labeling.
customer_reviews.text: This product labeling and information is completely misleading. It does "not" absorb urine, and I haven't seen anything that looks like gel absorption in this product. Also, it does leak all over the floor causing a lot of time cleaning up after. Don't waste your money or time buying this product. It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: PAF

customer_reviews.title: The Hartz Lavendar scented doggie pads (40/XXL) are great. We use to use the small pads (20"x ...
customer_reviews.text: The Hartz Lavendar scented doggie pads (40/XXL) are great. We use to use the small pads (20"x 20") and we had to always change the pads because our little Chihauhau uses the pads a lot. Our dog is house trained and only do her business on the pads and when we're at work, I put down 2 pads of the XXL and that would be enough until we get home in the evening. Glad we got the XXL pads they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THEY STINK!
customer_reviews.text: I was only on my 2nd pad and I started getting a bad headache due to the horrible synthetic lavender smell. The day I used these for my puppy he started having accidents outside his potty area and I’m convinced it was because of the odor of the pads. These stink like a really cheap perfume. If you are sensitive to synthetic smells don’t bother. I threw away the rest of the pads. My garbage stunk so badly I had to remove them and put the whole package outside. Waste of money I’m going back to fragrance free.
customer_reviews.author: Egbor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for litter boxes and bad cats!!!
customer_reviews.text: I need to buy stocks in these! I have tried many pads and these are the best. I use them for my 4 misbehaved cats that like to go next to the litter box. They absorb a ton. I have a cat that is 20 so she has more output than your younger cat and these absorb all the liquid. I love this large size.. and shape. I know they are just rectangular but I built a cat house for my cats and the square pad dont work well. The price frequently changes on these products. So it is possible to get a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Allfruit

customer_reviews.title: Best ones on the market!
customer_reviews.text: My dog (albeit she is very spoiled rotten and she loves to be pampered, so the lavender works wonders) loves these, and will always go on them. The smell is pleasant and not too perfumey at all. The urine and liquids turn into gel and are locked in almost instantaneously. There will be people who say it leaks - but the only leaks I've seen are because she misses the target by a couple inches and it actually comes out a little on the edge and it leaks off. It's not perfect, but it 100% does what it advertises.
customer_reviews.author: JD Holmquist

customer_reviews.title: The pad works great and nothing seeps through when I use it on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly dog that cannot make it if I get stuck working late. I put one of these on the tile where she would occasionally have an accident and surprisingly she will go pee only on this pad if she cannot make it until I get home. The pad works great and nothing seeps through when I use it on tile. I have not used it on carpet, but there is a thin plastic liner underneath the pad that prevents it to "leak". I have a 30lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mustradi

customer_reviews.title: Love these pads!
customer_reviews.text: Our tea cup chihuahua is a senior. The lavender scent is great. After she pees, it absorbs into a gel so you dont smell strong pee. I throw it away once she pees on it 2-3 times (depending on how big the pee spots are). We use these for when we are in town all day and can't make it home.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: May as well let the go directly on the floor!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 small dogs who usually can't get through the night without having to go. SMALL YORKIES. These pads may as well not even be on the floor! I bought these being a name brand Hertz but they are utterly worthless. I have to mop every day because it's like a paper towel on the floor! Don't waste your money, I'm so angry about the quality of these pads.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: They work okay but...
customer_reviews.text: if you step on them (even just the edge) they stick to your foot, shoe, sock, barefoot it doesn’t matter. I bought pads a few different brands and these are the only ones with this issue. In fairness, We have a 5.5week old puppy and she is still too young to bring outside. So the pee pads are (for the moment) being used to protect a larger area of carpet with foot traffic. Once she can go outside i would be putting them in only one spot, more out of the way. At that point stepping on it would not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: David Watson

customer_reviews.title: My little guy's favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I have a crate trained chihuahua and he is in a crate big enough for my border collie's. He has a potty pad on one side and his bed and food and water and toys on the other. I had these pads in there and then tried to switch to charcoal pads, the dog would not poo on them. I thought ok, eventually he would. Nope. As soon as I put one of these back down he did. So needless to say these are on subscription! The lavender smell is a nice addition and not overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: MQuinn

customer_reviews.title: An amendment...
customer_reviews.text: ...unfortunately, I cannot find my previous rave. I reviewed the wrong product. When we finally got around to opening THIS package, we were sorry we purchased. I don't know if we got an old product or what. I can't imagine that Hartz would sell a product that leaks like paper; not anything like the product I raved about (my spouse does this chore, and I thought he had just opened it) ! We still have the package, and have only used one, but it was purchased back in July. Sorry if my former post led anyone astray. Maybe it would be fine for the tiniest dog in the world. So no, I would not recommend, nor would I buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JTXan

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Won't Use It!  Very Non-Absorbent.
customer_reviews.text: My small dogs have used pads for many years. This is the first time they have refused to even step on one. I'm guessing they don't like the lavender scent or the smooth pad texture or the unusual dimensions. I slowly poured 1/2 cup water about 6" in from the 1 1/2" border and watched it immediately run out across the edge and onto as well as under the pad. The pad area is about 18" out of the 21" width so if you are used to a normal XL pad, you need two of these to cover the same space.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: No leaking
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Our shih tzu is trained to use a pad usually it's a one or 2 and done the whole surface filled and leaking into the liners tray. These training pads are the best ever in 14 years of purchasing pads for her, the tinkle takes up a smaller area allowing a tinkle or two more, which of course raises the value with no leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Smell is light and nice
customer_reviews.text: Seems to absorb smell well. I can't smell the lavender unless I actually put the unused pad up to my nose but when I do the smell is nice. I have used other brands that drip urine when I pick them up and this doesn't. I have a chihuahua who is a senior and apparently picky and refused to go on another brand. My dog was housebroken but due to his age he can't always hold his urine so he needs the pads. They work great for our purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Meesha77

customer_reviews.title: they work like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I was buying pee-pee pads from a big box store in my town and having problems with them leaking. I ordered a small supply of these Hartz pads and all my problems have been solved. The perform exactly as they describe and my 16 year old dog (who has lost control with age) seems to like them better. They do hold the urine in a small area allowing for continued use. No odor no leaking...yahoo! Just ordered another bigger supply of them to get us through the cold months. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: DelNana

customer_reviews.title: Not As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog who uses training pads indoors. These training pads are advertised to prevent trafficking urine because there's supposed to be gel in the pads. Even a small amount of urine doesn't immediately get soaked into the pad. I don't recommend these at all. They're also very thin. Advertised as super absorbent, but they're not at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job & is large
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I tried another brand and that brand was subpar 2 these. These r large and only takes one instead of two of the other brand. The other brand was black & difficult 2 tell when was wet. Also the other brand was slippery when wet like stepping on a rock with wet moss. I almost fell several times because u couldn’t tell when they were wet! These r the best brand and u can c when they r wet and they hold the urine on the pad and don’t leak. It only takes one pad for an area instead of two, so they r actually more cost efficient. This is the brand for me.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ4JC

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I would give these zero if I could. They could not be any worse. Very thin, won't absorb, the pee pee goes straight through them. So flimsy they are never laying flat just bunched up. My pup is a little German Shepherd who turned 8 weeks old two days ago, so I would have expected these to work. Ordered another brand which will arrive today. Can't wait as these are totally useless. Amazon why are you selling something this bad?
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.text: These do have a nice smell to them but unless your dog is about 2 lbs, you’ll be mopping up the rest of the mess. My 9lb Chiweenie just wrecks these. Also, in picture provided, you can see there isn’t any stuffing throughout the whole pad. There are like 6 flattened cotton balls in there. Which makes it obvious as the why it’s not absorbing. Oh and it’s for some reason much slicker, so my pup moves it all around and it often ends up upside down and she goes on the wrong side, also not helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Tovar

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Leaks everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Horrible waste of money. Leaked everywhere and also because of the cheap material slides all over hard floors. It is stuffed with cotton and if you have puppies that like to shred they can easily pull out cotton and shred everywhere. Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great with an indoor potty.
customer_reviews.text: I finally gave up and bought an indoor potty last year for my puppy who at 2 pound did not do good in the bitter cold and snow. After washing it daily I decided something had to change. Now I only have to change it weekly with the use of these potty pads. There is no smell according to my visitors. and it locks in the potty to one little area so it can be used longer. I have never had a leak with them. These are a life saver
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: It does take a second for it to absorb, but smells great, dont leak unless its really full. Definitely a good buy tho
customer_reviews.author: Katie L.

customer_reviews.title: Was hopeful but my dog was not..
customer_reviews.text: Bought these Hartz pads at a very low price. I was hopeful that the lavender will cover the smell of my shitzu's poop... It did. But my shitzu refused to poop on them. I gave it 3 days try out. He kept pooping around it. I went back to my Costco brand dog pads and my Shitzu is doing his business again on the pads. These pads are very thin, I wouldn't recommend it for male dogs.
customer_reviews.author: rferreira

customer_reviews.title: Not very absorbent/sticks to shoes
customer_reviews.text: First, these don't absorb all the liquid unless the dog pees directly on the center of the pad. Near the edge, it will flow off and soak the underside. Second, these have some sort of adhesive all over the pad that will stick to the bottom of your shoe, which moves the pad from its intended position. Nice price and the scent is okay, but for its primary purpose, it's just not that good.
customer_reviews.author: RDavid

customer_reviews.title: I use these because of the ordor protection
customer_reviews.text: First I am a disabled veteran and I had to potty train her to use the pads. I cannot walk very long or often. I have brought a pad holder, because she would go on the edge thereby making her urine go on the floor. Well I had to get the pad holder to keep the pad down and for her to use the center of the pad. Now she sometimes won't use it. The holder works for us. I love these pads.
customer_reviews.author: Forpeace4Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Should be called extra thin and extra small .
customer_reviews.text: Smell great.hold per, but are very small not xl like it says. I have to put two down compared to the other brand of so that I only use one. I hate that they are super thin. Dog walking on them they bunch up and slide around on the carpet. Way to thin to stay put even when my cats run across them they flip over.
customer_reviews.author: Mackobubis

customer_reviews.title: Love the gel
customer_reviews.text: Great potty pads: extra absorbent, the gel does a great job. The thin pads don't absorb as fast as pup "goes" and he ends up standing in a puddle; his feet get wet and he gets distracted right in the middle of everything. The 21"x21" are working well for a 7lb pup -- he's a toad and won't go on one that's already been used at all, so we swap them out often and the smaller size makes sense for us. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Coby Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Potty Oads
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old standard poodle is required to stay indoors for a few weeks. The scent was a little off putting to her at first. However because I put it in the same location her potty bass went when she was a puppy. She finally peed after holding it for 10 hrs. The only problem I had was not with the product it was the giant Amazon box. You could just put it into your big Amazon ship bags. MaryPaula
customer_reviews.author: MaryPaula A.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: My wife ordered these for her new little puppy chihuahua. These pads definitely help with training a puppy to poop and pee in one spot. Some dogs don't like the scented pads, but my wife's puppy couldn't care less. This little dog will pee and poop on almost anything. He even uses these pads to play Tic-Tac-Toe! Better theses pads then your carpets though! Definitely worth it! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Joe La

customer_reviews.title: Sadly-Leaks through
customer_reviews.text: I continued to purchase these because I thought maybe my fur baby was just being sneaky and peeing off the mat but it actually is these pads and the urine goes through them. I'm upset because I like the smell of these and the fact they are gel. I have to use two pads on top of eachother now so they don't leak and that way I can use up the rest of my order so I can then purchase a different brand that hopefully doesn't do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pads. The scent on them is great helps keep odors away.I bought these a few times but the last package I got I don't know what happened the pads would stick to each other and tear each time I tried to open them took me awhile to figure out so the pee would leak through.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda s.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, pleasant but not overwhelming fragrance
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product as an adjunct to the the floor protection surrounding my cat's litter box. She's senior and cannot always control placement. So these pads, in addition to a senior litter box are helping me protect my floors. The pads are superb and hold moisture well. NO leaks. It is performing better than I ever expected. I am very sensitive to fragrances, so I minimize the use of air fresheners and products that have an strong odor. The lavender fragrance on this product is a nice bonus, and IMO not overwhelming as to be be an air freshener strength.
customer_reviews.author: Stell

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: The first set I bought for our puppy were charcoal pads that promised the stars. Those were not really leak proof and if the puppy peed on the border, it would leak out. But then I switched to these lavender pads and they are perfect! They do what they say they will; "won't leak, won't spread." And it blocks leaks at the borders. The only thing is that the lavender scent is a bit pungent at first, but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: lizette529

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s really frustrating such a simple product costs so much and still can’t be manufactured properly. I buy these all the time but I still get batches that are bad like in the photo where the absorbent cotton inside is all bunched up in different places and this batch I even got some with the cotton fluff falling out. Terrible quality control. Unfortunately I haven’t found any brand that is consistently good.
customer_reviews.author: NikLu

customer_reviews.title: Geat Absorbency!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15lb dog that is trained to potty pads. She is 3 years old so I have tried A LOT if different brand potty pads. Many of them are one use only. With these she will wet on them 2-3 times because they are so absorbent! They do not leak! I am very impressed and will buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelley0939

customer_reviews.title: Great pads for all dogs of all ages.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs have been pad trained since 8 weeks old. They’re both 11 yrs old now. These pad are amazing, they have a nice smell and it still attracts my dogs to it to pee/poop. They’re so easy to clean up bc they absorb a lot I change them 2 times sometimes 3 times daily. I just take a cleaner and paper towels to clean where the pads were and all finished. Simple and easy also cleaner than most products. Also great price.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Utz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you'd Expect!
customer_reviews.text: These are overall my favorite wee-wee pads for Sir Blueberry. He is 8 lbs and as long as you don't let the pad sit there for more than 2 uses you will be fine. The smell is in the pad not just in the packaging so the freshness is released with every new one unfolded. P.S. I am not so sure how the absorption would hold up on bigger dogs as Blueberry had company over and both using the pad it seeped through a bit, but over all I still like this brand and sent.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Enthusiasts

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant scent, quality pad!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my 7 lb Yorkipoo, especially during the rainy winter months. I have purchased many different brands and have paid anywhere from $1 for 10 pads to $30 for 50 pads (charcoal pads). These Lavender gel pads are a good option because my dog can pee on it multiple times before I need to dispose of it. The gel holds the urine in one spot and the Lavender scent keeps it from stinking up the house of urine. Paying a little extra is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for house training
customer_reviews.text: I love these for my pup. Perfect for training my pup to go potty outside. Easy to dispose of. 99.99999 times does not leak. Only if he is left alone for 12+ hours due to work and he can not hold it and goes ALOT but I recommend these 100% to any dog owner! I buy these at the store all the time and got these on a great deal! Best dog pad product on the market in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Di Swan

customer_reviews.title: They don’t gel! Very thin pads.
customer_reviews.text: The pee stays wet on these pads forever. My puppy is only 3 pounds, and she doesn’t pee a Huge amount. These pads do not gel like they claim! Your dog will track through the wet pee, and then you will have pee paw prints all over your floor. And the dog will remark or pee wherever they smell their own urine. These pads are super thin, and not absorbent.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dilbeck

customer_reviews.title: Threw them in the trash
customer_reviews.text: These are like tissue paper. Very thin and leaky. I am a foster dog mom and always have puppies in my home. These were so worthless I literally threw them away. I used them on hardwood floors and they were so flimsy every time my pups steps on them they get scrunched up. If you hold a dry one up to the light you can see right through them in some places where there isn't enough filling. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Smith

customer_reviews.title: lavender training pads for dogs
customer_reviews.text: If you have an issue with smells you wont want these. The lavender is so strong I had to air the pads out, outside to be able to tolerate the smell. They dont stay tight on the pad holder, the yellow stain shows when the dog pees, I will continue to use the charcoal pads instead, no problems with them what so ever. Do NOT recommend these pads at all!
customer_reviews.author: sandra e smith

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: My senior cat became incontinent at the end of her life and we wanted something to help cleaning her area be easier and quicker. We tried these instead of our washable pads. We only got through half the box before she passed but we never had a leak. They kept her mostly dry if we didnt notice a mess right away. We felt this was a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Great Pads
customer_reviews.text: These pads are ten times better than the other pads (Thinner blue without the gel) I am glad I found these on here and for a great price. I highly recommend these. We have a Yorkie and he uses them just fine. I think he prefers these because they have a little cushion to them and doesn't feel like he is stepping on the floor. They do not drip either, they really hold the liquid.
customer_reviews.author: AaronDrTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog pad
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars because they were a little smaller than I like. I have two small dogs that use the pads. I did love that if my dog went near the edge of the pad the urine didn’t go underneath the pad as most pads I have tried does. I will order again in a larger size. If you don’t like perfumy smells you may not like these otherwise I found them good even though no thickly padded
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I give these 4 stars. I wish the price was a bit cheaper. I love the lavender scent. It’s not over powering but does the job. They also absorb really well. They are a bit thin but definitely do the job. They work well for my adult dogs. I would give a higher rating and would Purchase more often if they were a bit cheaper. I definitely prefer these to others I have bought.
customer_reviews.author: savvy

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all!
customer_reviews.text: This product fell way short of the description! I would only recommend for someone who has one tiny dog, who barely pees. These had almost no absorbency and totally leaked all over. The dogs and cats were attracted to the pads, but other than that, they were useless. I'm very disappointed with this item and will not order again, nor recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly Girl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, thin and don't stay in place.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not what I thought a pee pee pad should be. I am used to the Costco box of 100 that is x-large at a fraction of the price. This product is way too thin, way to cheap, and is so feather light anything blows it out of place. mmeeehhh is how I feel about the scent in this pad. I love lavender scent too. This product failed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia C. Morales

customer_reviews.title: My dog prefers these
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these out for my older dog who won't go outside when it is raining, I put it beside one that was a generic unscented brand and every time she goes for this one. No leaks and the size is perfect because she can never aim right for the center of the smaller ones. These will be what I buy from now on. The scent is not too strong but strong enough that if I don't pick it up immediately it helps with the dog urine smell.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna P

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Not the same quality! Very poor! NOT AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: What happened??? This used to be my go to pee pad because they were so good! These arrived with a torn package, some were torn and had to be trashed. The absorbency is awful! I would have sent them back but I needed them bad. I am very disappointed in this product and this purchase.i won’t order this product again! Update: I’m having to mop every time my dog uses this pad!!!
customer_reviews.author: Love my Dogs

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing to me about puppy pads, is that they don't leak. These leak.
customer_reviews.text: Right on the front of the package it says that these do not leak. They absolutely do leak. Now I have a black stain on my hardwood floor, which is the only place that I have room to put the puppy pad in my small apartment. I have to use 3 puppy pads at one time, plus I have them on a plastic boot tray. The best thing about these is the lavender scent does cover up the odor.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M.

customer_reviews.title: Kept sticking to my feet ! Ahhhh
customer_reviews.text: I normally love the hartz lavender gel pads so I didn't think these could be that different but for some reason the pee didn't absorb right away and just like went right onto the floor and the pee pads kept sticking to my feet any time I walked near it .... it drove me insane ! I have never had that problem with any pee pad I ever have used !
customer_reviews.author: SoullessSally

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my puppy I’ll be getting in May, it looks reasonable sized and the quality is nice but the only issue I see with it is the smell. God, it’s sooooo strong! I could smell it before I could even open the box, it’s so potent! I’m afraid the puppy is not going to use it because of how strong the scent is, it even made my nose turn up but that’s really my only issue with it. If you like strong fragrance and your dogs do too this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Paper thin; no absorbency!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand in the past and purchased from in the store. So I was very excited when I saw them in bulk on Amazon. I purchased the 140 count size and was very disappointed when they arrived and opened the package to find that I could see through them and any liquid rolls right off of the pad because it has practically no absorbency material inside.
customer_reviews.author: CrazySxyCool

customer_reviews.title: Dog Pee Pads Really Work!
customer_reviews.text: My dog will use these if we are not home or if he needs to and we have not let him out into the back yard. He is a rescue dog now 10 years old. Very smart and was well trained. I found the first pads I brought were not thick enough - so I purchased these for more protection from leaks. They work very well. I do sometimes put a couple on the floor in the continual (designated) bathroom. He amazes me. What a great guy!
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen & Dennis Duling co-authors

customer_reviews.title: The lavender scent is really nice. The pads do an excellent job of absorbing ...
customer_reviews.text: Much higher quality than the other piddle pads I've used in the past. The lavender scent is really nice. The pads do an excellent job of absorbing and keep the tray nice and dry for easy clean up. (Side note: My puppy has actually destroyed more of these pads while attempting to "play" with them (despite the tray holder I have the pad set in...) opposed to "using" them, so I advise if you have a destructive pup that the pad remnants are cleaned up well... since there is a material in the pad to turn the liquid to gel(just like a baby diaper) I could see the potential hazard if the materials are ingested.)
customer_reviews.author: KYB

customer_reviews.title: Snow, Storms or Snowstorms....
customer_reviews.text: When your full grown dog weighs 8 lbs and you’re from New England you have to make creative concessions. During storms or winters that have ice and snow deeper than 6 inches I use these pads with the framing tray. Relieves all stress as there’s no odor or leakage. I’ve used these now for 4 yrs. There isn’t another brand that even comes close.
customer_reviews.author: djgeez

customer_reviews.title: Definitely reordering more today!
customer_reviews.text: These are very absorbant. I've tried some store bought brands, but their absorbancy isn't very good. These are great. No liquid gets beneath them. Do make sure you get the right size for your pet. These don't really have a scent (maybe a SLIGHT lavender scent) except for an attractant that makes your pet want to use these pads verses your rugs or floors. They also seem to absorb the smells until you can get them picked up. I love these and my little girl loves these! I'm reordering more today.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Urine soaks through them
customer_reviews.text: I use this under the cat box in case my cat misses. But if I put a clean pad out before I leave for work at 8:30, and the pad gets urine on it while I’m at work the urine has soaked through the pad and gotten onto my bathroom floor by the time I get home at 5:30. I have a 7 lb cat and most of her urine gets in the catbox, this is just a back up and they still leak.
customer_reviews.author: Jewlery Fan

customer_reviews.title: The xl is the largest most absorbent I have found yet.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best I have tried! I have a great pyreenees puppy that hasn't been house broken yet. The puppy is 55lbs and about 3 months old. So we need BIG pads! These hold enough to get through thenight with 2 pads. They weigh a ton once filled but thebacking holds it in. Puppy likes the smell and is happy to use the pads. They are also big enough to fit her huge paws and bumm on.
customer_reviews.author: Bless The Nest

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Time and Money
customer_reviews.text: The labeling is not true. The urine soaked right to the floor. The was no gel core to contain it. I’m doubling all pads, one down to dry the floor when it soaks through and one up....What a waste of money. I’ll see how it goes tonight. I may be returning them tomorrow for an exchange....I talked to Hartz, the manufacture today and told them how unhappy I am....she had me hold them up to the light. The so called filling to hold the urine was barely there....Don’t waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.author: coachingqueen

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY pads that have worked!
customer_reviews.text: After 3 long years of potty training, trying EVERYTHING (outdoor/indoor whatever just not on the carpet) with my rescue dog, these are the only pads she ended up catching on with! Is it the scent? Pretty color? I have no idea! It was honestly like magic. I’ve tried every pad, spray, treat, exaggerated praise you can imagine. These are amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: The Only Positive is the Lavender Smell
customer_reviews.text: They smell like lavender which was wonderful, but as far as using them in the manner they are intended to be used, not worth the money paid. Sorry, I really wanted to like these but there are so many negatives, I just couldn't. Now I just use them as nice smelling drop cloths when I polish silver or clean small objects.
customer_reviews.author: Sbumom324

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Leak everywhere. Not absorbent.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these pads have become unacceptable. Months ago I purchased thsm and they were pleasantly scented and acceptably absorbent. Since then they have gotten worse and worse. As soon as you remove them from the packaging they are not compressed. My 6lb elderly min pin floods them with one use. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: These pads are great !!
customer_reviews.text: I recently read the reviews and most of them were negative feedback about this product but honestly I still went ahead and ordered it because I needed pads for my dog ASAP. I must say these pads are really good. I haven’t had a bad experience yet. My dog pees in it and it absorbs the urine quickly, there is no leak. I recommend these pads for small breeds
customer_reviews.author: India

customer_reviews.title: Loving them!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best puppy pads ever. I have a 15 year old dog and he cannot control his bladder anymore so I lay these out and he goes poop on them and even pee. I’m at work all day and most days I come home to multiple pee spots on them. I’m glad to know my dog is now trained to go on the pads when he needs to pee or poop. And my dog loves the scent. I’ve caught him rubbing himself on a clean pad. And it’s leak proof. So happy with this purchase and buying more since I ran out.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Not absorbant, but something else
customer_reviews.text: Not absorbant, seems like urine just rolls off instead of soaking up, I’ve been cleaning puddles off the floor the whole time I’ve had these. I just wish I hadn’t bought such a big pack, I had to throw them away and get something different. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Glass

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The Worst pads I have ever bought in my entire life and I’ve had dogs my entire life. And it’s a trusted source so I thought they would be good, but I was so wrong. I have Chihuahuas and if it rains we all know they don’t go outside. And when they use the potty pad and went straight to the floor. I should’ve just threw down some newspaper and save the money. Do not buy will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: I spend to much money here.

customer_reviews.title: Smell great!
customer_reviews.text: These smell great and keep all leaks contained. These are best used after your dog has already been trained on puppy pads as the smell can be confusing for them during initial training. Once they have their "spot" trained with pads you should be able to switch to these with ease. I prefer the fragranced ones now as they keep the area much fresher smelling however they were not good for me with initial training.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good during  potty training
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my new labradoodle who is still in the process of potty training. they come in a square form and are really thin. Shockingly even though they are really thin, they absorb a lot of pee. There is a powder smell to them, which i like-but if your sensetive to smells you may not like. I've had to use them to clean up a mistake and they work really well. There are 70 in a pack so they last throughout the potty training period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I found these dog training pads thin but they did the job as advertised. I have multiple dogs and did not have to clean the area at all. The absorbency is good even though there is no quilting on the surface! The size is perfect as is the scent when first placed down. I will continue to purchase these and am very very pleased with the price, Thank you Hartz!!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Buy Paws and Pals instead
customer_reviews.text: My regular product was out of stock and this came up as a suggested replacement. They were very difficult to unfold and kept sticking to my hands. Would not recommend. They were folded up way too small into little bitty squares When the originals I have ordered multiple times only come folded up and 6 squares.
customer_reviews.author: L R.

product_meta.title: Hartz Home Protection Unscented Odor Eliminating Gel Dog Pads
product_meta.description: Color:Lavender Scented| Size:21" x 21"| Style:50 CountComing home to pet messes is not how anyone likes to unwind after a long day, which is why we set out to create the ultimate dog pad. The Hartz Home Protection line of training pads make clean-up simpler, pad replacement and disposal easy, plus safeguard flooring from unpleasant accidents. Excellent for dogs living in homes with limited access to the outdoors, senior pups with restricted movement, puppies in training or sick dogs, Home Protection has you covered at every corner. Our absorption experts analyzed urine distribution and designed a pad with 6 layers, containing our Flash-Dry technology which creates a smaller urine spot and allows for multiple uses per pad. When nature calls, Home Protection instantly turns urine into gel to reduce tracking and make clean up a breeze. A water-proof plastic backing and borders ensure our pads won’t leak or spread. The special odor eliminating capability within all our lavender scented pads traps and neutralizes stinky smells left behind, turning eww to phew.
feature_bullets: Unique Flash-Dry technology instantly turns liquid into gel, locking in moisture to prevent messy leaks and unpleasant odors
Includes 50 lavender scented dog pads infused with odor eliminating technology
Each 21" x 21" pad features a plastic backing and border to protect all floor types by blocking leaks
Our 6 layer construction dog pad creates a small urine spot, allowing your dog to find fresh, clean spots for multiple uses per pad
Available in smaller or larger size counts and perfect for housetraining puppies, senior or sick dogs, extended indoor stays and use during travel

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
